title: io.nats.jetstream.api.v1.definitions
description: Shared definitions for the JetStream API

stream_source.description: Defines a source where streams should be replicated from

opt_start_time.description: Time stamp to start replicating from

filter_subject.description: Replicate only a subset of messages based on filter

external_stream_source.description: Configuration referencing a stream source in another account

api.description: The subject prefix that imports the other account $JS.API.CONSUMER.> subjects

deliver.description: The delivery subject to use for the push consumer

stream_source_info.description: Information about an upstream stream source in a mirror

name.description: The name of the Stream being replicated

lag.description: How many messages behind the mirror operation is

active.description: When last the mirror had activity, in nanoseconds

lost_stream_data.description: Records messages that were damaged and unrecoverable

bytes.description: The number of bytes that were lost

cluster.description: The desired cluster name to place the stream

tags.description: Tags required on servers hosting this stream

name.description: The server name of the peer

current.description: Indicates if the server is up to date and synchronised

active.description: Nanoseconds since this peer was last seen

offline.description: Indicates the node is considered offline by the group

lag.description: How many uncommitted operations this peer is behind the leader

leader.description: The server name of the RAFT leader

replicas.description: The members of the RAFT cluster

total.description: Total number of API requests received for this account

errors.description: API requests that resulted in an error response

memory.description: Memory Storage being used for Stream Message storage

storage.description: File Storage being used for Stream Message storage

max_memory.description: The maximum amount of Memory storage Stream Messages may consume

max_storage.description: The maximum amount of File storage Stream Messages may consume

max_streams.description: The maximum number of Streams an account can create

max_consumers.description: The maximum number of Consumer an account can create

subject.description: The subject the message was originally received on

seq.description: The sequence number of the message in the Stream

data.description: The base64 encoded payload of the message body

time.description: The time the message was received

hdrs.description: Base64 encoded headers for the message

code.description: HTTP like error code in the 300 to 500 range

description.description: A human friendly description of the error

consumer_seq.description: The sequence number of the Consumer

stream_seq.description: The sequence number of the Stream

stream_name.description: The Stream the consumer belongs to

name.description: A unique name for the consumer, either machine generated or the durable name

delivered.description: The last message delivered from this Consumer

num_ack_pending.description: The number of messages pending acknowledgement

num_redelivered.description: The number of redeliveries that have been performed

num_waiting.description: The number of pull consumers waiting for messages

num_pending.description: The number of messages left unconsumed in this Consumer

durable_name.description: A unique name for a durable consumer

ack_wait.description: How long (in nanoseconds) to allow messages to remain un-acknowledged before attempting redelivery

rate_limit_bps.description: The rate at which messages will be delivered to clients, expressed in bit per second

max_ack_pending.description: The maximum number of messages without acknowledgement that can be outstanding, once this limit is reached message delivery will be suspended

idle_heartbeat.description: If the Consumer is idle for more than this many nano seconds a empty message with Status header 100 will be sent indicating the consumer is still alive

config.description: The active configuration for the Stream

state.description: Detail about the current State of the Stream

created.description: Timestamp when the stream was created

sources.description: Streams being sourced into this Stream

messages.description: Number of messages stored in the Stream

bytes.description: Combined size of all messages in the Stream

first_seq.description: Sequence number of the first message in the Stream

first_ts.description: The timestamp of the first message in the Stream

last_seq.description: Sequence number of the last message in the Stream

last_ts.description: The timestamp of the last message in the Stream

deleted.description: IDs of messages that were deleted using the Message Delete API

consumer_count.description: Number of Consumers attached to the Stream

name.description: A unique name for the Stream, empty for Stream Templates.

subjects.description: A list of subjects to consume, supports wildcards. Must be empty when a mirror is configured. May be empty when sources are configured.

retention.description: How messages are retained in the Stream, once this is exceeded old messages are removed.

max_consumers.description: How many Consumers can be defined for a given Stream. -1 for unlimited.

max_msgs.description: How many messages may be in a Stream, oldest messages will be removed if the Stream exceeds this size. -1 for unlimited.

max_bytes.description: How big the Stream may be, when the combined stream size exceeds this old messages are removed. -1 for unlimited.

max_age.description: Maximum age of any message in the stream, expressed in nanoseconds. 0 for unlimited.

max_msg_size.description: The largest message that will be accepted by the Stream. -1 for unlimited.

storage.description: The storage backend to use for the Stream.

num_replicas.description: How many replicas to keep for each message.

no_ack.description: Disables acknowledging messages that are received by the Stream.

template_owner.description: When the Stream is managed by a Stream Template this identifies the template that manages the Stream.

discard.description: When a Stream reach it's limits either old messages are deleted or new ones are denied

duplicate_window.description: The time window to track duplicate messages for, expressed in nanoseconds. 0 for default

placement.description: Placement directives to consider when placing replicas of this stream, random placement when unset

mirror.description: Maintains a 1:1 mirror of another stream with name matching this property.  When a mirror is configured subjects and sources must be empty.

sources.description: List of Stream names to replicate into this Stream

streams.description: List of Streams managed by this Template

name.description: A unique name for the Template

config.description: The template configuration to create Streams with

max_streams.description: The maximum number of streams to allow using this Template
